t: Numbers 26
The Second Census
After*p the plague the Lord*s said to Moses and Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest,
“Take a census of the whole Israelite community by families—all those twenty years old or more who are able to serve in the army of Israel.”
So on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them and said,
“Take a census of the men twenty years old or more, as the Lord*s commanded Moses.” These*p were the Israelites who came out of Egypt:
The*p descendants of Reuben, the firstborn son of Israel, were: through*ln Hanok, the Hanokite clan; through*ln Pallu, the Palluite clan;
through*ln Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through*ln Karmi, the Karmite clan.
These*p were the clans of Reuben; those numbered were 43,730.
The*p son of Pallu was Eliab,

and the sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan and Abiram. The same Dathan and Abiram were the community officials who rebelled against Moses and Aaron and were among Korah’s followers when they rebelled against the Lord.*s
The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, whose followers died when the fire devoured the 250 men. And they served as a warning sign.
The line of Korah, however, did not die out.
The*p descendants of Simeon by their clans were: through*ln Nemuel, the Nemuelite clan; through*ln Jamin, the Jaminite clan; through*ln Jakin, the Jakinite clan;
through*ln Zerah, the Zerahite clan; through*ln Shaul, the Shaulite clan.
These*p were the clans of Simeon; those numbered were 22,200.
The*p descendants of Gad by their clans were: through*ln Zephon, the Zephonite clan; through*ln Haggi, the Haggite clan; through*ln Shuni, the Shunite clan;
through*ln Ozni, the Oznite clan; through*ln Eri, the Erite clan;
through*ln Arodi, the Arodite clan; through*ln Areli, the Arelite clan.
These*p were the clans of Gad; those numbered were 40,500.
Er*p and Onan were sons of Judah, but they died in Canaan.
The*p descendants of Judah by their clans were: through*ln Shelah, the Shelanite clan; through*ln Perez, the Perezite clan; through*ln Zerah, the Zerahite clan.
The*ln descendants of Perez were: through*ld Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through*ld Hamul, the Hamulite clan.
These*p were the clans of Judah; those numbered were 76,500.
The*p descendants of Issachar by their clans were: through*ln Tola, the Tolaite clan; through*ln Puah, the Puite clan;
through*ln Jashub, the Jashubite clan; through*ln Shimron, the Shimronite clan.
These*p were the clans of Issachar; those numbered were 64,300.
The*p descendants of Zebulun by their clans were: through*ln Sered, the Seredite clan; through*ln Elon, the Elonite clan; through*ln Jahleel, the Jahleelite clan.
These*p were the clans of Zebulun; those numbered were 60,500.
The*p descendants of Joseph by their clans through Manasseh and Ephraim were:
The*p descendants of Manasseh: through*ln Makir, the Makirite clan (Makir was the father of Gilead); through*ln Gilead, the Gileadite clan.
These*ln were the descendants of Gilead: through*ld Iezer, the Iezerite clan; through*ld Helek, the Helekite clan;
through*ld Asriel, the Asrielite clan; through*ld Shechem, the Shechemite clan;
through*ld Shemida, the Shemidaite clan; through*ld Hepher, the Hepherite clan.
(Zelophehad*ld son of Hepher had no sons; he had only daughters, whose names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah and Tirzah.)
These*p were the clans of Manasseh; those numbered were 52,700.
These*p were the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: through*ln Shuthelah, the Shuthelahite clan; through*ln Beker, the Bekerite clan; through*ln Tahan, the Tahanite clan.
These*ln were the descendants of Shuthelah: through*ld Eran, the Eranite clan.
These*p were the clans of Ephraim; those numbered were 32,500. These*p were the descendants of Joseph by their clans.
The*p descendants of Benjamin by their clans were: through*ln Bela, the Belaite clan; through*ln Ashbel, the Ashbelite clan; through*ln Ahiram, the Ahiramite clan;
through*ln Shupham, the Shuphamite clan; through*ln Hupham, the Huphamite clan.
The*ln descendants of Bela through Ard and Naaman were: through*ld Ard, the Ardite clan; through*ld Naaman, the Naamite clan.
These*p were the clans of Benjamin; those numbered were 45,600.
These*p were the descendants of Dan by their clans: through*ln Shuham, the Shuhamite clan. These*p were the clans of Dan:
All of them were Shuhamite clans; and those numbered were 64,400.
The*p descendants of Asher by their clans were: through*ln Imnah, the Imnite clan; through*ln Ishvi, the Ishvite clan; through*ln Beriah, the Beriite clan;
and*ln through the descendants of Beriah: through*ld Heber, the Heberite clan; through*ld Malkiel, the Malkielite clan.
(Asher*ln had a daughter named Serah.)
These*p were the clans of Asher; those numbered were 53,400.
The*p descendants of Naphtali by their clans were: through*ln Jahzeel, the Jahzeelite clan; through*ln Guni, the Gunite clan;
through*ln Jezer, the Jezerite clan; through*ln Shillem, the Shillemite clan.
These*p were the clans of Naphtali; those numbered were 45,400.
The*p total number of the men of Israel was 601,730.
The*p Lord*s said to Moses,
“The land is to be allotted to them as an inheritance based on the number of names.
To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one; each is to receive its inheritance according to the number of those listed.
Be sure that the land is distributed by lot. What each group inherits will be according to the names for its ancestral tribe.
Each inheritance is to be distributed by lot among the larger and smaller groups.”
These*p were the Levites who were counted by their clans: through*ln Gershon, the Gershonite clan; through*ln Kohath, the Kohathite clan; through*ln Merari, the Merarite clan.
These*ln also were Levite clans: the*ln Libnite clan, the*ln Hebronite clan, the*ln Mahlite clan, the*ln Mushite clan, the*ln Korahite clan. (Kohath*ld was the forefather of Amram;
the name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, a descendant of Levi, who was born to the Levites in Egypt. To Amram she bore Aaron, Moses and their sister Miriam.
Aaron was the father of Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
But Nadab and Abihu died when they made an offering before the Lord*s with unauthorized fire.)
All*p the male Levites a month old or more numbered 23,000. They were not counted along with the other Israelites because they received no inheritance among them.
These*p are the ones counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
Not one of them was among those counted by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the Israelites in the Desert of Sinai.
For the Lord*s had told those Israelites they would surely die in the wilderness, and not one of them was left except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
